newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada raw materials prices fall 3.3 pct in Feb.
newsitem.headline: Canada raw materials prices fall 3.3 pct in Feb.

text.p: Statistics Canada said on Monday that its early estimate for the February raw materials price index showed a decrease of 3.3 percent from January.
The decrease was caused by an 11.3 percent drop in the mineral fuels index, Statscan said. All other major components increased, with the metals index leading the way, rising 1.1 percent.
The agency's early estimate for the wood index showed a rise of 0.5 percent, and of 0.5 percent for the vegetable and animal products marker.
The raw materials price index excluding mineral fuels is estimated to have increased 0.6 percent in February, the government agency said.

The raw materials price index reflects the prices paid by manufacturers for key raw materials. Unlike the industrial product price index, the raw materials price index includes goods that are not produced in Canada.
(For more information, contact Statistics Canada's Client Services Unit, Prices Division at (613) 951-3350.)
